Created an attachment (id=27219)
Here's an EAR without an application.xml

An EAR without an application.xml is not an Enterprise Application.  If you try
importing your test ear with the wizard, you will be stopped because the model
is invalid; the same is true using the API.  If the model is invalid, you can
still run the operation, like you did below, but there is no telling what may
happen.

I 100% agree that this is an invalid scenario. However, you shouldn't 
be "stopped" by a cryptic NPE.

OK, this will serve as an API documentation defect to better document the
IDataModelOperation framework to clearly state that if an IDataModel is not
valid, then all bets are off as far as the operation execution.  We will not be
putting any special case checking to check for various properties in the
operation to catch this sort of error however, because if we did, then we would
in effect be duplicating every single bit of validation in the IDataModel.  We
used to not run operations if the IDataModel was invalid, but there were some
cases where this was  desirable so the restriction was lifted.
